meanings.sent1: The temporary shelter provided a safe place for the lost hikers.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers put up temporary fences around the building site.
meanings.sent3: The temporary rain shower caught everyone by surprise during the picnic.
meanings.sent4: Her temporary absence left a noticeable gap in the team's dynamics.
meanings.sent5: The temporary tattoo on his arm started to fade after a few days.

meanings.sent1: The temporary marker on the whiteboard can be easily erased.
meanings.sent2: The temporary exhibit at the museum will only be here for a month.
meanings.sent3: His temporary excitement about the new toy quickly faded after a day.
meanings.sent4: The temporary fix on the broken chair didn't hold for long.
meanings.sent5: The temporary sign on the door indicated that the store was closed for renovation.

meanings.definition: Intended to be used for a short time
meanings.sent1: The temporary password will expire after 24 hours for security reasons.
meanings.sent2: The temporary employee was hired to cover for the regular receptionist on leave.
meanings.sent3: The temporary solution to the internet issue was to reset the router.
meanings.sent4: The temporary break in the rain allowed the kids to play outside for a bit.
meanings.sent5: The temporary bandage on her knee helped protect the wound until she got home.
